DOC.brief_summary: The aims of the study is to assess whether the intravenous infusion of 3 mg/kg erythromycin has a significant gastrokinetic effect leading to empty the stomach in less than 90 minutes in non-fasting patients undergoing emergency trauma surgery.
DOC.brief_title: Assessment of Prokinetic Effects of Erythromycin in Emergency Patients With a Full Stomach
DOC.criteria: Emergency surgery for trauma ASA 1 and 2 patients Full stomach (antral area > 550 mmÂ²) Adult patients No contraindication to erythromycin Extreme emergency surgery (time frame < 90 min between arrival in the service and the start of the surgery) gastroparesis or pathology associated with gastroparesis
